docs.title: Google Docs guide
docs.text:
Google Docs is a Google application for working with documents on any device.

You can create, edit, share, and print documents with Google Docs.

Before working in Google Docs, sign in with Google.

How to Sign in with Google?

From this guide, you will learn how to:

  • Create Google documents.
  • Manage access to Google documents.
  • Manage page settings.
  • Format text.
  • Insert different types of content.
  • Manage add-ons.

docs.title: Create Google documents
docs.text:
There are several ways to create a Google document.

The easiest way to create a Google document is to:

  1. Open Google Docs.

  2. Click Blank document.

The new document is created.

Alternatively, you can create a new Google document:

  • From another Google document.
  • From Google Drive.

To create a new document from another Google document:

  1. Open a Google document.

  2. In the File menu, click New > Document.

To create a new document from Google Drive:

  1. Open Google Drive.

  2. Click New.

  3. Click Google Docs > Blank document.

The new document is created.

docs.title: Format text
docs.text:
There are many ways to format text in a Google document:

  • Set up the font and font size of text.
  • Make text bold, italic, underlined.
  • Color and highlight text.

To format text, use the icons on the toolbar.

docs.title: Set up the font and font size of text
docs.text:
To set up the font of text:

  1. On the toolbar, open the dropdown list of fonts.

  2. Select the necessary font.

To set up the font size of text, on the toolbar:

  • Click the Decrease font size icon or the Increase font size icon.

  • In the dropdown list, select the necessary font size.

docs.title: Make text bold, italic, underlined
docs.text:
To make text bold, select the text you want to change and click the Bold icon.

Alternatively, select the text and press the Ctrl+B keyboard shortcut.

To make text italic, select the text you want to change and click the Italic icon.

Alternatively, select the text and press the Ctrl+I keyboard shortcut.

To underline text, select the text you want to change and click the Underline icon.

Alternatively, select the text and press the Ctrl+U keyboard shortcut.

docs.title: Color and highlight text
docs.text:
To color text:

  1. Select the text you want to color.

  2. Click the Text color icon.

  3. Select the text color.

To highlight text:

  1. Select the text you want to highlight.

  2. Click the Highlight color icon.

  3. Select the highlight color.

docs.title: Insert different types of content
docs.text:
You can insert different types of content in a Google document, such as:

  • Images.
  • Tables.
  • Charts.

docs.title: Insert images
docs.text:
To insert an image in a Google document:

  1. Open the Google document.
  2. In the Insert menu, click Image.

  3. In the dropdown menu, select the source of the image:

    • Upload from computer.
    • Search the web.
    • Drive.
    • Photos.
    • By URL.
    • Camera.

  4. Select the necessary image and click Insert or Open.

The image is inserted in your document.

docs.title: Insert tables
docs.text:
To insert a table in a Google document:

  1. Open the Google document.
  2. In the Insert menu, click Table.

  3. Set the table size or select a table template.

    • To select how many rows and columns you want to add, use a pointer.
    • To insert a table template, click Table templates and select the necessary template.

The table is inserted in your document.

docs.title: Insert charts
docs.text:
To insert a chart in a Google document:

  1. Open the Google document.

  2. In the Insert menu, click Сhart.

  3. Select the type of the chart or insert the chart from Google Sheets.

    To insert the chart from Google Sheets:

    1. In the Chart menu, click From Sheets.
    2. Select the necessary spreadsheet and click Select.
    3. Select the needed chart.
    4. If you want to add the link for the chart, select Link to spreadsheet.
    5. Click Import.

The chart is inserted in your document.

docs.title: Manage access to Google documents
docs.text:
Google documents are saved in Google Docs and Google Drive. You can share your documents with other users with Gmail accounts.

How to create a Gmail account?

You can share your documents with specific people or via the link.

docs.title: Share Google documents with specific people
docs.text:
To share a Google document with specific people:

  1. Open the Google document that you want to share.

  2. In the File menu, click Share > Share with others.

    Alternatively, click the Share button.

  3. In the field, enter the Gmail addresses of people you want to share your document with.

  4. Click Done.

  5. Select the access level:

    • Viewer.
    • Commenter.
    • Editor.

  6. Select Notify people and type a message if necessary.

  7. Click Send.

docs.title: Share Google documents via the link
docs.text:
To share a document via the link:

  1. Open the Google document that you want to share.

  2. In the File menu, click Share > Share with others.

    Alternatively, click the Share button.

  3. In General access, open a drop-down list and select Anyone with the link.

  4. Select the access level:

    • Viewer.
    • Commenter.
    • Editor.

  5. Click Copy link and then click Done.

  6. Send the link to people you want to share your document with.

docs.title: Share Google documents from Google Drive
docs.text:
You can also share your document from Google Drive.

To share a document from Google Drive:

  1. Open Google Drive.

  2. In the menu, click My Drive.

  3. In the menu of the file you want to share, click Share.

  4. Select how you want to share your document.

    • To share your document with specific people, click Share and repeat the steps for sharing with specific people.
    • To share via the link, click Copy link and send the link to people you want to share your document with.

docs.title: Manage add-ons
docs.text: To do more with Google Docs, you can use add-ons. Some add-ons can help you create bibliographies, forms, equations, diagrams, and more. Add-ons run inside Google Docs and can be installed from Google Workspace Marketplace.

docs.title: Install add-ons
docs.text:
To install an add-on :

  1. Open the Google document.

  2. In the Extensions menu, click Add-ons > Get add-ons.

  3. In Google Workspace Marketplace, select the necessary add-on.

    Tip

    Use the Search field or filters to find the necessary add-on.

  4. Click Install.

  5. Follow the instructions to install the add-on.

The add-on is installed.

docs.title: Start using add-ons
docs.text:
To start using an add-on:

  1. In the Extensions menu, select the add-on.

  2. Click Start.

docs.title: Uninstall add-ons
docs.text:
To uninstall an add-on:

  1. In the Extensions menu, click Add-ons > Manage add-ons.

  2. Select the add-on that you want to uninstall.

  3. Click Uninstall.

  4. Confirm the uninstallation by clicking UNINSTALL APP.

The add-on is uninstalled.

docs.title: Manage page settings
docs.text:
To manage page settings in a Google document:

  1. Open the Google document.

  2. In the File menu, click Page setup.

  3. Select the necessary format of your document: pages or pageless.

    To select the pages format, open the Pages tab.

    To select the pageless format settings, open the Pageless tab.

  4. Change the settings for the chosen format.

    For the pages format, you can set up the following page settings:

    • Application of the settings:
      • To the whole document.
      • To the selected content.
    • Orientation:
      • Portrait.
      • Landscape.
    • Paper size.
    • Margins.
    • Page color.

    For the pageless format, you can set up a background color.

    To set up a background color, click the expanded arrow and select the suitable color.

    Optional: Click Set as default to apply chosen settings to any new documents you create.

  5. Click OK.
